Uses of Class
board.Board

  • Packages that use Board 
    Package Description
    board  
    pieces  

    • Uses of Board in board

      Methods in board that return Board 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Board Board.deepCopy()
      Makes a deep copy of the board - including the individual pieces on the board, their location, and color.
      Board Board.tryMove​(java.awt.Point[] points)
      Tries a given move on a copy of the current board to check if the move is a valid move -- i.

    • Uses of Board in pieces

      Methods in pieces with parameters of type Board 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void Bishop.basicMovement​(Board b, java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> getMoves)
      This method populates the getMoves ArrayList with the valid moves for a particular bishop object on the board b that is passed in.
      void King.basicMovement​(Board b, java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> getMoves)
      This method populates the getMoves ArrayList with the valid moves for a particular king object on the board b that is passed in.
      void Knight.basicMovement​(Board b, java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> getMoves)
      This method populates the getMoves ArrayList with the valid moves for a particular knight object on the board b that is passed in.
      void Pawn.basicMovement​(Board b, java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> getMoves)
      This method populates the getMoves ArrayList with the valid moves for a particular pawn object on the board b that is passed in.
      void Rook.basicMovement​(Board b, java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> getMoves)
      This method populates the getMoves ArrayList with the valid moves for a particular rook object on the board b that is passed in.
      void Pawn.capture​(Board b, java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> getMoves)
      This method checks the immediate diagonal left and right to see if there is a piece of the opposite color and if so then that point is added to the ArrayList.
      void King.castling​(Board b, java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> moves)
      This method adds valid castling moves to the getMoves ArrayList if the king and rook can castle.
      void Queen.diagMovement​(Board b, java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> getMoves)
      This method populates the getMoves ArrayList with the diagonal valid moves for a particular queen object on the board b that is passed in.
      void Pawn.empassant​(Board b, java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> getMoves)
      This method checks the immediate left or right of a pawn and checks the following: the correct row for enpassant, pawn to the left or right, pawn with the enpassant variable set to true, pawn is of a different color.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> Bishop.getMoves​(Board b, boolean check)
      This method calls basicMovement to populate the ArrayList Moves and checks if each move puts its own king in check
      java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> King.getMoves​(Board b, boolean check)
      This method calls castling and basicMovement to populate the ArrayList Moves and checks if each move puts its own king in check
      java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> Knight.getMoves​(Board b, boolean check)
      This method calls basicMovement to populate the ArrayList Moves and checks if each move puts its own king in check.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> Pawn.getMoves​(Board b, boolean check)
      This method calls capture, enpassant, and basicMovement to populate the ArrayList Moves and checks if each move puts its own king in check.
      abstract java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> Piece.getMoves​(Board b, boolean check)
      Abstract method to be implemented in each sub class of Piece -- returns the valid Points that a piece can move to on the board
      java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> Queen.getMoves​(Board b, boolean check)
      This method calls diagMovement and LineMovement to populate the ArrayList Moves and checks if each move puts its own king in check.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> Rook.getMoves​(Board b, boolean check)
      This method calls basicMovement to populate the ArrayList Moves and checks if each move puts its own king in check.
      boolean King.kingInCheck​(Board b, java.awt.Point point)
      Checks if the opposing pieces puts the current players king in check.
      void Queen.lineMovement​(Board b, java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> getMoves)
      This method populates the getMoves ArrayList with the up, down, left, and right valid moves for a particular queen object on the board b that is passed in.
